paper_abstract: This paper deals with the robust H-2 fuzzy observer-based control problem for discrete-time uncertain nonlinear systems. The Takagi and Sugeno (T-S) fuzzy model is employed to represent a discrete-time nonlinear system with parametric uncertainties. A fuzzy observer is used to estimate the state of the fuzzy system and a non-parallel distributed compensation (non-PDC) scheme is adopted for the control design. A fuzzy Lyapunov function (FLF) is constructed to derive a sufficient condition such that the closed-loop fuzzy system is globally asymptotically stable and an upper bound on the quadratic cost function is provided. A sufficient condition for the existence of a robust H2 fuzzy observer-based controller is presented in terms of linear matrix inequalities (LMIs). Moreover, by using the existing LMI optimization techniques, a suboptimal fuzzy observer-based controller in the sense of minimizing the cost bound is proposed. Finally, an example is given to illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed design method. (C) 2006 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Robust H-2 fuzzy output feedback control for discrete-time nonlinear systems with parametric uncertainties
